abstract: Commissioner Bud Selig said that baseball has a tentative schedule for making two 15-team leagues, which means one National League team would have to join the American League.
snippet: Commissioner Bud Selig said that baseball has a tentative schedule for making two 15-team leagues, which means one National League team would have to join the American League.
lead_paragraph: Commissioner Bud Selig spoke to reporters before Game 4 of the World Series on Sunday and revealed that there was a tentative schedule in place for league realignment.

headline.main: In League Realignment, Which Team Goes to the A.L.?
